intro: Viguiera densifolia, commonly known as Mexican heath, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. Its leaves are gray-green and fuzzy, while its flowers are yellow with purple markings, adding ornamental value to gardens. Viguiera densifolia is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
